alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Clinton; Highland; Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BROWN, NORTHWESTERN ADAMS, SOUTHERN CLINTON, WEST CENTRAL PIKE AND SOUTHERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 615 AM EDT... At 545 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Mount Orab, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Georgetown, Mount Orab, West Union, Peebles, Lynchburg, Winchester, Sardinia, Seaman, Belfast, Russell, New Market, Emerald, Decatur, Russellville, Hamersville, Mowrystown, Cherry Fork, Sinking Spring and Danville in Highland County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
